name: Out of Season Holiday Let
short_description: Dwelling let during off-season (tenancy not exceeding 8 months)

notice_requirement.timing: Before or at start of tenancy
notice_requirement.content: Notice must state possession may be recovered under Ground 3
notice_requirement.exception: Court may dispense if just and equitable

future_use.requirement: Landlord requires possession for holiday letting
future_use.timing: Must be for future holiday season

notice_period.court_proceedings: Can be started after notice expires

evidence_required: Written notice given at tenancy start
Evidence of prior holiday letting (booking confirmations, holiday let website, council tourism registration)
Evidence of intended future holiday use (advance bookings, marketing materials)
Proof property was used for holidays within 12 months before tenancy

high_probability: Clear written notice at tenancy start
Strong evidence of prior holiday use
Genuine intention to resume holiday letting
medium_probability: Some evidence of holiday use but limited
Intention to resume holiday letting is genuine but no firm bookings
low_probability: No notice given and court refuses to dispense
Cannot prove holiday use within prior 12 months
No genuine intention to resume holiday letting
Property not suitable for holiday lets

red_flags: No written notice given at start
No evidence of prior holiday use
Landlord has multiple ASTs suggesting not genuine holiday let
No holiday letting license (if required by council)

typical_timeline.seasonal_note: Often timed to regain possession before summer holiday season

tenant_defenses: No notice given and no good reason to dispense
Property not used for holidays in prior 12 months
No genuine intention to resume holiday letting
Landlord using ground as pretext for eviction
notes: Ground 3 is MANDATORY but rarely used. Most common in coastal areas. Landlords must prove genuine holiday letting history and intention to resume.
case_law: Blancett v Rhondda Cynon Taff County Borough Council [2001] - Holiday use must be proved
R (on the application of Woolfe) v Wigan MBC [2003] - Intention to resume holiday letting must be genuine
